title: Husband died. I can't drive motorhome. Upside down. Owe $100k, dealer says it's worth $45k. Bankruptcy?
question: Bank said have dealer sell it. I tried. He said he can only get $45k.. I owe $100k. I want to give it back. But will they put a lien on my home? (Equity is $60k). Up to date with payments. FICO is very high. I pay $934 a month to Bank of the West... I could do stuff if I wasn't paying for it. I have $25k in savings and a $21k in cash. I'm 70 and retired. I have a pending lawsuit for negligence in my husband's death. I owe $6k on a rental (value $30k). I make $150.00 Per month off it. I keep it for taxes. I have good income, $90k yr
answers: My colleagues have given you good advice. Find/consult/hire a lawyer using the Avvo feature "Find a Lawyer". Make a list of 4-5 having many 5 star reviews from satisfied clients. If you don't get a prompt call back from one, go on to the next on your list. Some offer a free consultation by phone or in person.
So sorry for your loss and the tough situation. You really need to consult with a bankruptcy attorney right away to assist you in determining the least expensive way to move forward.

Lots of potential issues here. Get a consult to go over everything. This may seem a bit out there but can you turn the MV into tiny home or AirBnB and get enough income to make the payments? Just a thought.

I strongly suggest that you sit down with an experienced bankruptcy attorney to discuss your options.

A Chapter 7 case does not seem like a good fit for you. I believe that your income may be too high to qualify. You certainly are at risk of losing assets if you file a Chapter 7.

A Chapter 13 repayment bankruptcy might be a possibility, but more information about your debts and expenses would be needed to give you a good answer.

It is worth your time and money to talk to an attorney in person. Good luck.
